He's the same in the morning, but at school he grows when a bully threatens him

111.content:
“Get out of here, Simon!!”

“Yeah, you lanky freak! No one wants you on our team. You’ll screw everything up again!”

Simon scowled but turned around and headed to the other side of the playground, away from the more athletic eleven and twelve year old boys who were getting ready to play a game of kickball. He didn't particularly like the game, but he was desperate to make some friends, any friends. Unfortunately, his reputation as a klutz seemed to have preceded him.

“Did you see the last time he tried to play?” Simon overheard Greg, a blonde-haired, tanned-looking boy, asking the rest of the guys on his team. “When he was at the plate, he whiffed the ball three times in a row, the last time falling flat on his face in the process!”

Feeling the blood rush to his face, Simon (mostly) held back his tears and picked up his pace, trying to get as far away from these jerks as possible. As he started to run however, he began to lose his balance, and his feet tangled together, sending him crashing to the dirt. As he lifted himself up, picking up the glasses that had fallen off of his face and putting them back on, he prayed that no one had seen what just happened.

Unfortunately, by the sounds of laughter coming from behind him, his prayer had gone unanswered. “There he goes again!” Greg yelled out, his surprisingly baritone voice grating in Simon's ears. “Klutzy Simon can't even walk from one side of the school yard to the other without taking a dive!”

While the rest of the boys continued their hooting and hollering, Simon quickly rose to his feet and got out of there as quickly as possible, thinking to himself how satisfying it would be if he could only find some way to teach those asswipes a lesson.

*****

That night, Simon was laying on his bed, reading the latest issue of his favorite magazine, National Geographic, which has just come in the mail that day. The cover story focused on different reports of alien abductions, taking a generally dismissive attitude towards virtually all of them. "Regardless of the fervent testimony of a few zealotous alien apologists," Simon read the last paragraph of the article, "the fact remains that there has yet to be any conclusive evidence presented for any alien's existence in the first place, much less their contact with humans. However, one thing we can all agree on is that, if they ever do contact us, we shouldn't expect to see little green men."

"Ain't that the truth," a voice from the other end of the bed said.

Simon yelled a little and jumped back in fright. What looked like a boy his own age was sitting across from him, smiling softly at him. He looked like any average ten-year-old, except that he was glowing white all over, like some sort of ghost, or angel.

"W-who are you?" Simon asked, his lips quivering slightly. "How'd you get into my room?"

"Calm down, Simon," the boy said, "I'm not here to hurt you. I'm a visitor from another dimension, what you might call an 'alien', though I don't really come from another planet, and this is for sure not what I really look like. But I'm here to help you."

Help me? Simon thought to himself. How could someone like him help me? Out loud, he simply said, "What-- what do you mean?"

Standing up, the shimmering boy began to slowly walk around the room. "There's something very unique about you, Simon, something that allows you to do and become things that no other human could even dream of. To put it as simply as I can, you're the descendent of someone who came to your world centuries ago from the same dimension I'm from, and we want to get you back home. To do that, though, we're going to need to work on developing some of the abilities that lay dormant within you."

Unique? Abilities? Home? Simon wasn't quite sure he was following along, or if he was just imagining or dreaming the whole thing. Still, if what this … being … if what he said was true…

"What kind of abilities are we talking about?" he asked, his curiosity piqued.

"Well, I can't say for sure exactly how they'll manifest themselves within you," the boy said as he sat back down on the bed, closer to Simon. "A lot of that's to be seen, and you'll have a lot of choices to make. I just need to know that you're willing to believe in me. Otherwise, I can't help you."

Simon thought long and hard for a few moments, wondering whether he did truly believe in what he was hearing. Finally, he nodded, slowly at first but then more enthusiastically. "Yes! Yes, I do want to believe you!"

"Great! Then we're set to begin tonight!" The boy stood up and walked over to the wall, then suddenly seemed to disappear through it.

"Wait!" Simon called out, reaching out his hand after the boy.

"Yes?" Simon heard the voice, though the figure didn't return.

"Um, do I need to do anything?"

"Not tonight," the boy reassured him. "At least, nothing that you'll actually be aware of. But tomorrow might be a little… interesting. For you and anyone you come across."

And with that, the voice went silent, and Simon could tell that he had left for good, or at least for the evening. Leaning back in his bed, he thought for a long time about what had just happened, imagining what changes could happen to him over the course of the next few days. He didn't really have any idea what could happen, but he knew that it sure sounded exciting.
111.title: Simon's Quest

choices: Cory, the dark-haired, tan-skinned athletic boy, who's super-popular
Austin, the red-headed, pale-skinned, dorky, quiet boy
1111.content:
When Simon woke up the next morning, he instantly felt different, though he couldn't quite put his finger on it. Just getting out of bed felt different, as if his body was heavier. Remembering the night before, he quickly ran to the bathroom and looked in the mirror, shocked at what he saw: he appeared to be a full two years older. He was about five inches taller than before, and his body was noticeably more developed, though he still was still very skinny.

"Wow!" he exclaimed aloud. "That's pretty cool."

He waited for a moment, not quite sure if he should be expecting a response or not, but when nothing answered him back, he shrugged, smiled, and went back to his room to start getting ready for school. Looking through his closet, he noticed that his clothes, while still very much the same style he had worn before, now seemed to be a bit larger, as if they were made for a twelve year old. "That's strange," he wondered, "I guess they grew with me too."

It was even stranger, though, when he went downstairs and sat down at the breakfast table. He braced himself, waiting to see his parents' reaction, but neither of them seemed to bat an eye. Finally, after he was half-finished with a silent breakfast, he coughed slightly, and asked, "Mom?"

"Yes, Simon?" she replied.

"Ummm," he thought for a moment, not quite sure of what to say. "Do you notice anything... different about me this morning?"

She looked at him with a questioning look, but then shook her head. "No, I don't think so. Why?"

Simon decided to keep his secret for now. "No reason." He tried to think of a way to ask her how old she though he was, but he couldn't figure out how to do that without appearing to be crazy. He finished his breakfast and then headed off to school soon after, wondering if everyone else around him saw him as a twelve year old just like his mom apparently did.

That question was answered as soon as he saw where he was being dropped off for school. Instead of the elementary school that he was used to going to, he noticed that he was walking into the middle school a block over. It was a strange feeling, and he fought an instinct to turn around and run back to the elementary school, but he figured if that, with everyone else treating this day as normal, he just had to go with the flow.

Of course, the thrill of being, or at least appearing to be, two years older than he had been just the day before immediately subsided when he realized that being twelve years old in a middle school meant he was in the youngest group of students. And the difference between other twelve-year-old sixth graders like himself and the fourteen-year-old eighth graders was substantial. Even tall as he was for his age, there were boys who towered over him, and almost all of them could out-muscle him any day of the week. He took a deep breath as he walked down the halls, hoping not to get noticed, at least for now, and also wondering if in this reality he had any friends here -- or enemies, for that matter.

When the bell to start class rang, he soon realized that he had no idea where to go. Luckily, a teacher standing in the halls noticed his bewildered state and called out to him, "Well, Simon, will you be joining us in homeroom today or not?"

Simon breathed a sigh of relief as he quickly ran into the room. "Sorry," he said, quickly scanning the walls for signs of the teacher's name, "Mr. Corwall." The teacher smiled in acknowledgement, and Simon quickly hurried to the only empty seat left in the class.

As the roll began to be called, Simon looked around at the rest of the students in the class. No one seemed to notice him or object to his presence in the room, or even wonder who he was, but he didn't recognize a single face. He started to sweat a little. If reality had changed like this around him, even if it did mean that he had gotten a little older, it would be nice to have some sort of control, or at the very least a cheat sheet.

"Hey," he suddenly heard a voice whisper, "Simon."

He whirled around his head, looking for the source of the voice, but saw nothing. He quickly realized, however, that it was the same voice from last night. He started to say something, but then stopped, realizing that if the other students didn't notice the voice, and he began to talk back to it, he might be seen as deranged, or at the very least get in trouble.

"Don't worry about answering," the voice snorted, slightly indignant. "Yeah, yeah, I know you're in class. Fine, then I'll do all the talking. I hope you've enjoyed the first little surprise this morning. I sense, though, that you seem to be uncomfortable in this new situation, especially not knowing anyone around you. Tell you what. I'll fill you in with some of the information on this reality. Ready?"

Simon didn't quite know how to answer or what to expect, but after a second, his head suddenly began to fill with memories of the past two years, finishing elementary school, going through the first scary days of middle school, meeting all his classmates and teachers -- it all flooded in. In a moment, he knew every one of the other students' names, and he knew what the rest of his schedule was and where the classrooms were. It was as if he had actually lived the past two years that he had skipped overnight, but deep down, he knew that it wasn't the reality he had experienced.

"Hmm," the voice said, "I think something's missing. It looks like the way your backstory has unfolded, you don't have a single friend in your school. Well, I guess we can fix that. And this is where I can start to give you a choice. Look around the room here, and choose one of the other boys. I'll make it so that in his mind, and in yours, you two will have been best friends since you can remember-- a deep, lasting friendship. Just, whichever one you concentrate the hardest on, that'll be the one that I pick. 'Kay?"

Simon wanted to protest, to ask for more information, or another chance, but the voice seemed unable or unwilling to read his thoughts. So he had to pick somebody, it seemed. Looking around the room, he tried to decide which one looked like the best choice for a best friend, drawing upon what he knew of them from his newfound memories. Finally, he made his choice.
1111.title: Life a little bit older

choices: He changes him and Austin to be exactly like the sketches.
He makes some modifications to the sketches, then changes reality to match.
11112.content:
After considering the matter for a few minutes, Simon finally settled on Austin. Sitting at the side of the wall near the windows, Austin looked like he kept mostly to himself, but after searching through the new memories in his head, Simon realized that Austin was very intelligent but humble, and had a sweet, caring side to him that rarely came out in class. Simon didn't want his new friend to be so popular that they never got to hang out or talk, so Austin seemed to be the best choice.

After deciding this, a flash of light came over him, and Simon found himself in the seat next to Austin. Looking over, he saw that Austin was doodling something on one of the pages of his notebook, though he couldn't quite make out what. Austin saw that Simon was looking his way, and a smile started to creep across his lips. He started to say something, but then was interrupted by the teacher, who was continuing with the lecture.

Simon's head began to fill with new thoughts of his life as best friends with Austin. The two boys had known each other since kindergarten, and they hung out every chance they got. They were both only children, but they treated each other like brothers, sharing nearly everything and always getting into scrapes and friendly fights with each other, though their more cerebral sides would also lead to them helping each other on homework and pursuing more creative things, like writing. Neither of them had many other friends, but the bond between them was about as close as could be. Simon could even tell that there was a hint of something more than friendship, but it had never developed much.

Finally, the bell rang, and the students started to empty into the halls. As Simon got up, Austin quickly ran up to his side. "Wanna see my latest sketches for 'The Deadly Duo'?" He nearly hopped up and down with boyish excitement, clutching his notebook tight to his chest as he did so.

"The wha--?" Simon stopped himself mid-sentence, as he came across the memory of a comic book the pair had been working on for the last year or so. As far as he could tell, the work was more of just talking about ideas for characters and plot events, along with a few doodles, but nothing concrete. "Oh! Yeah, sure. Is that what you were drawing in class?"

"Mm-hmm," Austin nodded in affirmation. He handed over the notebook, opened to the page with fresh pencil marks (along with a few leftover eraser shavings). "What do you think?"

Simon studied the page closely. The first thing that jumped out at him was how good of an artist Austin was. The sketches were rough, sure, but the body models and facial expressions were on their way to being the quality of a professionally published book. But the biggest thing that struck Simon had to be the two character's appearances. They were big and muscle-bound, like superheroes should be, but there was no denying that they held a striking resemblance to Austin and himself - one with the shaggy red hair and glasses matching Austin's, and one with the shorter, spiky black hair and Asian appearance like Simon's. It was an uncanny resemblance.

"Wow!" was all that Simon could answer. "It looks… really good!"

Austin beamed with pride at this praise. "Thanks, man! I'm glad you like it! I can't wait to get home and ink and color them!"

Simon smiled, but as he did so, he felt a certain sense of power come over him, a strange yet familiar feeling. He could tell that this was an indication that he could make a choice to change reality again, but he wasn't quite sure how. He kept expecting the voice to return, but it never did. "Maybe," he thought to himself, "this is a sign that I need to act on these opportunities myself. But what should I change?"

Looking down at the notebook in his hands, he knew he had the answer.

Gwen “Yah. I don’t wanna be mean, but those muscle are starting to get freaky. The first day, he was kind of cute, but not so much any more.”

At the same time, Ben was listening to their conversation. Hear them say this stuff about him made him angry.

“I don’t care if I look freaky. I’m super strong.”

Gwen and Gramps turn around in surprise.

Gwen “Be reasonable. How are you going to tell you mom and dad! ‘Oh… I had a super growth spurt over the summer?’”

Ben fumed “Maybe…”

Gramps “Come on Ben. Remember you said that you didn’t want to be super huge just a few days ago.”

Ben “That was then. This is now.”

Gramps was about to say something, but he didn’t get to because Ben turned around and ran into the forest.

Gwen “There he goes… are we going to do anything about it?”

Gramps sighed “We should, but it won’t matter. Only he can decide…”

*Back with Ben*

Ben had enough of their criticism, and just turned away. He just wanted some place quiet so that he could fume. Eventually, he reached some inland lake. He found a fallen tree, and sat on it. He stared into the water.

Ben “Its not fair! I found the dang thing, but they want to take it away. Its mine.”

Ben just sat there and talked himself out of his anger. Eventually, his thoughts drifted over the lake. He looked at his reflection and wasn’t as happy as he thought he would be. There was a kid that looked like a 15 yo staring back. He was average height, but his tremendous bulk made him look shorter. He was about as wide as he was tall.

Ben “Maybe they were right.” Silently, Ben wished that he was smaller. A size that was his age, but slightly above average. After a moment, Ben felt a strange sensation. Something that was totally new to him. It was a tremendous wave of pleasure surging over him from his now 20in long rock hard penis. Instinctively, Ben took off his pants and started to jack off. However, instead of cum coming out, a strange bulge formed at the base of his shaft and worked its way to the top. When it got there, a green sphere popped out. However, the strangeness didn’t stop there. While Ben continued to wallow in his pleasure, his muscle seemed to shrink down. When Ben calmed down, he was confused at what happened.

What has happened?

Ben “What happened? That felt amazing.” He started to rub is eyes, but was surprised at what he saw. He was now 5ft 2in tall with a slightly above average build. He didn’t look freaky huge, but more on the really athletic side. He could pass for a 13yo instead of a 10, but that was ok. Ben was a above average in every aspect, and not just muscle. There was a certain organ that seemed slightly out of proportion from that rest of his body. It was about 7in long, but it didn’t seem like much in the mind of a 10yo.

Ben stared at himself admiring his smaller appearance. “I think this is good.” Then there was a flash of green at his feet and he saw the green orb. Ben picked it up and he looked at it. He tried gave it a closer look by putting it in the sunlight. As the sunlight passed threw the green crystal, the light turned green and landed on Ben. Ben felt a slight tingle in all his muscles as though they were growing, but got compressed instantly. “What’s going on.”

Ben took it out of the light and the feeling stopped, but when he put it back, the feeling returned. “It must be the sunlight passing though the orb” Ben concluded.

After a few more moments of examining his new body, he decided that it was time to return to the Rustbucket.

When Ben got back, Gramps and Gwen were surprised to see that Ben had shrunk down. They asked a few questions, and Ben tried to answer as best he could.

Gramps “Let me see the crystal.” Ben hands it over, and gramps looks at it curiously. “Well… this is indeed a growthium crystal ball, but its is several time large than ordinary ones. All others that have been found are only the size of a pearl, but this on is the size of a baseball. I wonder what that does to its growing properties. Usually, these orbs work only on the first organism it finds. That‘s until it dies of course.”

Ben stared at the orb trying to understand its abilities.

Gramps “Ben… may I try something?”

Ben nodded “Sure. You wanna see if it works on others?”

Gramps “Yah…” Gramps hold it up to the sun and lets the light fall on him.

What happens?

Ben walked up to the scale and got on it. As soon as he did, the numbers jumped to 800lbs. “Wow! How can I weigh so much!”

Gwen looked up at Gramps in anticipation “What? Time for what?”

Gramps “Hold up a minute. You’re acting just like Ben. I have to go in and get it first.”

Gwen quieted down because she was ashamed of acting like Ben, but the excitement inside her threatened to burst open.

Gramps came back with a small chest. “Ok. This will be test number 1. Open this box. If you can, then you ca have what ever is inside.”

Gwen “What?!?! I thought it’d be a present.”

Gramps “It is, but this is a gift from the planet your grandma came from. It is a test to see if you can handle what’s inside. If you pass, then you can take it.”

Gwen looked at the box defiantly. She wouldn’t be stopped by a simple test. Gwen walked up to the box. “Fine. I’ll do it.”

Gramps smiled in total confidence. “Ok. I’m going to put it on the ground. Give us a moment to get away because our bodies aren’t designed to handle the energy given off by the test.”

Gwen “Ok… thanks for the heads up.” Gramps and Ben walked away. When they were far enough not to be seen, Gwen proceeded to open the box. The box had an ancient design. It was encrusted in purple pearls and spheres. The silver surrounding the box was molded into complex patterns. The whole box was an enchantment. As Gwen’s fingers touched the box, there was a spark, and the box opened.

Ben “That’s it!?!”

Gwen turned around surprised to hear Ben’s voice. “What are you doing here? Gramps aid it wasn’t safe.”

Ben “He was just being overly cautious. Nothing even happened.”

Gwen tried to counter, but had to admit that she had expected more.

Ben “Well? What’s in the box.”

In all the confusion, Gwen didn’t even look inside the box. Gwen took out an object that was cloaked in a purple cloth. She slowly unwrapped the object and she saw a silver bracelet that had a trinket shaped like a book.

Ben “Well?”

Gwen was about to say something, but Gramps came running into the clearing. “Ben!!! I told you it wasn’t safe.”

Ben “Well. Nothing happened. Gwen touched the box, and it opened.”

Gramps turned to Gwen in surprise “It seems to me that you are stronger that you appear.”

Gwen “What do you mean?”

Gramps “Ever citizen of your race can open that box. Each time, they get something from it. However, it takes time for the box to open because it need to absorb a large amount of mana before it opens. There for, it takes time for weaker people to open it. About a year or even longer. If it opened that fast, then your level of magic muscle be very high.”

Gwen “Really?” Gwen said with pride.

Ben glared at her slightly jealous at how fast his sudden changes were so easily put aside. However, he was still curious as to what Gwen got. “What did you get anyway?”

Gramps “Well lets see. It different for every person that uses magic.”

Gwen took out the bracelet. “Well. Its this silver bracelet. It has a purple book/trinket that looks like its made of a purple gem stone of something.”

Gramps “Well. There’s only one way to find out. Put it on.”

Gwen slipped the bracelet on but nothing happened. “Umm… Gramps. Does it take time or something.”

Gramps thought for a moment, then he said “Some times, these things have a trigger. It could be a phrase or emotion… Just something to get it going.”

Everyone was quiet until Ben spoke up “I think there’s a word on your little trinket.”

Ben “Awesome!” What does the book say?”

Gwen “I don’t know. Let me open it.” Gwen flipped to the first page and saw that everything was in English. Except of the runes and symbols. Those were written in the language of her species. There were spells on every page, but the weirdest part was that they were written so the Gwen understood it perfectly. “This is amazing. It seems like every spell in the universe is in here.”

Ben just grabs a folding chair and sit down with the green orb on his firmly chiseled chest and rock hard six pack. As the sun hit it, it increased his muscle density instantly. However, something was wrong.

*During the ride*

Gramps “Ok I’ll talk about the book on the way. I’d take a seat if I were you.”

A long time ago, on Gwen ancestor’s planet, the mages or the planet were in a struggle of power along with the rest of the universe. Every species wanted one thing, while the others wanted another. So there were wars fought over small issues. The planet of Anodyne, Gwen’s ancestor’s, and its inhabitants were sought after for their assistance because of their unique abilities. Your people obliged to help what ever cause they believed in, and they generally agreed. Except for this one time only. A spunky Anondite, the inhabitants of Anodyne, named Xen was traveling the skies like most teenagers of your race. However, he was unlucky enough to meet Deceit. This monster of an alien had the slipperiest tongue in the universe. He could weave a lie so complex that it seems to take on a life of its own. He got to Xen and told him a lie about an upcoming rebellion within their society. One half wanted to dominate the universe while the other half wanted to retain peace. Deceit lied about wanting peace, and he told about a future so beautiful that Xen had no choice but to agree. Together they worked for the next decade gathering allies and collecting resources. After that, things began to move a lot faster. Xen and Deceit and their army of a million Anondites, and other aliens faced off against the supposed evil. This supposed evil was Xen’s grandpa, Spectus, or Watcher. Spectus has seen the change in his grandson long ago and turned to his Donum, his gift from the box. It was a purple gem encrusted book. He opened it and said “Veritas. I wish to learn the truth.” With that, the book glowed and words began to appear.
The book “Xen has been deceived by Deceit. Deceit wishes to take over Anodyne and enslave all of your people. I advise you use spell 598.”

Spectus “Oh yes. A most apt spell. It reveals the intent of all living things. Thank you.”

The book “No problem. Glad to help. You better hurry. Deceit is nearing your walls.”

Spectus sighed and stepped out into his balcony. He made a few signs in the air and wave of light washed over the land. As it passed over the army, everyone saw the lie that had covered the truth and chaos ruled the army. Everyone went everywhere. Deceit glared at Spectus as his army dissipated.

Spectus “Deceit. When will you learn.”

Deceit glared and let out a roar that shook the soul of every person that heard it.

Spectus “Veritas. What do you think is the best way to show this monster the truth.”

The book “Maybe threw a lie. Let him live his fantasies in his dreams for all eternity.”

Spectus “What a nice solution. What would I do without you?”

The book “A lot actually. Its nice to talk to someone though.”

Spectus “True… true. Now let see.”

Spectus casts a spell on Deceit sending him into eternal sleep and restoring peace to their planet.

Gramps “Gwen. I think you have to book of the Great Spectus. His book was his greatest advisor and resource. It holds the ‘TRUTH’ of all things.

Gwen looked at her trinket with new interest.

Ben was laying on his bed sleeping like usual. History lessons had always bored him.

Gwen “I wonder…” Gwen took out hew book and opened it “Veritas. What I want to know the truth.”

The book glowed a bit and word started to appear.

The book “Hello Gwen. I’ve been waiting. It been a boring millennia with out Spectus.”

Gwen looked at the book surprisingly “Umm. Sorry. This is kind of new to me so its kind of awkward.”

Book “Hah! Spectus said the same thing when he was a tyke. Fine… Just use spell 168 to give me an illusion of a body. It’ll help break the ice.”

Gwen did as he said and a boy about 13yo appeared. The kid had dirty blond hair and a Hawaiian tan. He was athletically muscle from what could have been surfing. The boy had on some casual looking cloths.

The boy spoke “Hey. Looking nice. The last body I had was a woman that was in her 20’s. Spectus had wanted a wife. It seems that this is what you look for in a boy.”

Gwen’s face turned bright realizing that this was something she had created in her mind, and that it was true. “N-n-n-nooo. I-ii-I-its just.”

Book “Gottcha! Its good to pull a leg every now and then. don’t worry. I got your back.”

Gramps was still sitting in his chair astonished by what he’s seeing.

Book “Ohh… a human name. That’s new. Yah I like that. That is if you’re asking me if I like it.”

It seems like the crystal is trying to get Ben to bring them all together. Also, I’ll tell you one more thing when Ben wakes up. For now, I’ll just get used to this illusion of a body.”

Gramps “Yah. It originated from the Green planet next to the green sun.”

Any how… the sun that the planet was next to released an energy that gave the crystal its ability to grow. However, it is about to super nova. All aliens in the universe are trying to harness its power to their own purposes. I suggest that you get Ben that thing of yours quickly and get over there.”

Anyway… as the planet orbit the green sun, it absorbed the energy the sun released. The energy absorbed altered the chemical atomic composition of the planter giving it incredibly unique properties. Which you already know about. However, this energy is special because it makes things ‘stronger’. It is part of the physical universe. Also, the energy released from the supernova could prove beneficial to any race that can grab hold of it. In the wrong hands, the universe could be controlled by one ruler.”

Gwen “We better get started.”

They go outside to see that Gwen had drawn a magic circle on the ground and surrounded it with symbols.

Ben “Hey Seth. What’s going on here?”

Seth “It’s a test to measure Gwen magical capacity. You should stay to cheer her on. This will be difficult. It takes decades of training to master this, but think Gwen can handle just a few hours.”

Ben looked at Seth with shock, and then turned to Gwen and stared in awe. “You can do it Gwen!”

Gwen looked at Ben and smile, but her face turned serious as she looked away. As she started to focus, the runes on the ground started to glow. Gwen began to float off the ground. When she started to chant in some the language of her homeland, reality seems to distort itself. The ground outside of the circle began to float up and orbit Gwen. As the chanting got faster and more sporadic, the air in front of her was being morphed and pushed around by something. Out of nowhere, a large glowing sun appeared in front of her. As the sun floated there, the ground beneath it started to get scorched, but reality seems to change again. The scorched land started to change. It went from rocks and earth to liquid water.

Ben “You can do it Gwen! We know you can!” Ben was yelling and jumping excitedly. That was until the ground below him got caught in the spell. Ben jumped up higher that time and landed on a tree up of the range of the spell. “Watch it!” Ben yelled accusingly.

Seth was standing and observing Gwen as she continued the spell. The test required her to keep the spell going for about an hour. When Gwen started, the spell was fairly easy to maintain, but as she hit the half way mark, she was feeling the tremendous drain on her body. She felt like their was a cramp all over her body and that she just worked out for the last five hours non stop.

Gwen thought “I don’t know if I can keep this up. Its just to difficult!” Gwen was about to let go of the spells, but she saw Ben to the side shaking his but at her and making faces.

Ben “I knew you couldn’t do it.”, and then there was more taunting.

All this did was make Gwen even more defiant and want to work hard. With renewed resolve, Gwen continued the spell. As the seconds ticked till the end, Gwen was suffering. Not even Ben could renew her resolve. 3...2...1...

Seth counted down the last seconds, and then all the spells collapsed and Gwen started to fall from the air. Just as she was falling, Ben ran up and caught her.

Gwen felt a weight less kind of feeling as she fell. All of a sudden, everything stopped. She felt a strong heart beat and gentle arms get a hold of her, and carry her. She felt the warmth from Ben body, and the strength in his arms. As her mind receded into deep sleep, he last though was remembering how her dad used to carry her when she was little.

*Hours later*

The sky was dark as Gwen looked out the window. Wasn’t it noon just second ago? As she sat up, she felt how sore she was. All of a sudden, Gwen remembered the test and how Ben caught her… and how sense of security. She realized that Ben had changed a bit. As she slowly got up, she looked out the window and saw that everyone was sitting in a little camp fire laughing and joking around. Gwen looked at Ben trying to see what has changed.

Ben looked like a 13 year old kid with a larger swimmer’s build. He looked strong, but not like that freakish kind of builds, and was about 5ft 2in tall. His chest pushed about an inch and a half, and it hugged his shirt nicely. Threw the shirt, you could see a set of nicely chiseled abs. His legs looked quick and agile, but also very strong, so did his arms. If he wasn’t Gwen’s cousin, she would have dated him, but since he is her cousin, the idea is appalling.

Ben noticed Gwen in the window and waved her to come over.

Gwen smiled, and went to join them by the warming campfire.

*The next day*

Gramps “How are you feeling Gwen? You did something amazing yesterday. I’m very proud.”

Ben smiled knowing that he helped a little, but kept quiet as he wallowed in self pride.

Gwen on the other hand gave Ben a glare, but was happy Ben was there.

Seth “Ok… You’re ready to use the spell. If my skills as judging these exams have not deteriorated, then I believe that you have a 10 out of 10. You are the second person to pass that test, but I don’t think there is time to be cheerful yet. The green star is on a deadline. We must more on.” Seth proceeded to walk out of the Rustbucket.

Gwen smiled and followed Seth. Ben and Gramps followed quickly behind.

Seth “The spell will get easier with time. The first time will be as hardest, but as you get understand it better. It will still use the same amount of energy, but understanding the spell helps you maintain a positive attitude about using it.” “This spell does not require an incantation which makes it difficult to perform, but that’s also why it get easier to do as you understand it. You will need to know visualize the general of where you want to go, and imagine that reality is folding onto itself to bring you closer to your desired location. Give it a shot.”

Gwen did as Seth said, and imagined standing next to the tree 10 ft away. After a moment, Gwen felt a sudden drain on her body as though she ran a marathon, and just finished. Gwen was about to fall, but someone caught her.

Ben “God! You’re falling a lot lately. Good job though.”

Gwen opened her eyes and saw that she was next to the tree, but Ben was there holding her. The safe feeling returned, but Gwen caught herself before she started to get to deep in thought. Gwen gave Ben an evil smirk.

Ben looked at Gwen nervously “What’s that face for?”

Ben got his answer almost immediately. Gwen thought of Golden Gate Bridge in California, and imagined Ben there. Ben vanished from the camp.

*Back with Ben*

Ben appeared on the Golden Gate Bridge with a flash of purple.

Ben “What just happened?” Ben looked around and saw that a sign that said California. “Why am I in California!” Then Ben remembered Gwen’s evil smile and knew that Gwen did this. Ben remembered where the camp was and start to sprint to it. A person next to Ben freaked out when Ben appeared out of no where, but freaked out even more when Ben just vanished. Ben was running so fast that it looked like he disappeared.

*Back at the camp*

Gramps “Gwen! Where did you send Ben?” said surprised

Gwen “California, and Gramps… Ben’s going to be fine. I just wanted to see reaction when he gets back.

There was a streak of green the followed Ben as he stopped in front of Gwen. “That wasn’t cool at all.”

Gwen “I know. I didn’t get to see your face when you vanished. Oh well. I’ll do better next time.”

Ben “There won’t be a n-” Ben warped to California again, and ran back.

Gramps chuckled as Ben got back, but got serious when his plumber badge rang. Every one quieted down. Gramps answered the transmission. “Hello! Max Tennyson. What can I do for you?”

Xam “Are you near yet. The enemy has already attacked, and the green star is going to supernova in about a day. We need you here soon.”

Gramps “We’re already there!”

Everyone looked at Gramps like he was crazy, but Gramps took out a photo of the green star and showed it to Gwen. They all knew that Gramps wanted Gwen to send them there. There was a flash and then everything turned green.
141122211112111.title: Back with Gwen and her training

choices: Ben was growing faster than he was getting compressed.
1411222111121112.content:
Xam “What do you mean you’re already here.” In the background, it sounds like a person was giving a message. “Ok… Well send a transport shuttle over to get you.”

Gramps smile with satisfaction at his little joke.

Gwen “Why aren’t we suffocation in space?”

Gramps “Because the atmosphere around the green star is very similar to the air we breath on earth. The Green star is the strangest star in the universe. The only one of its kind.”

Ben “Um. Guys, I feel kind of strange.” There is a bright glow from his pocket. When Ben took the orb out and put it into the light of the green star, Ben felt like someone stuffed an air hose into his body and set the pump on to high. Ben felt cramps all over his body and he fell into the fetal position. “ohh…” Ben moaned.

Gramps “Ben! What’s wrong!”

Seth “It seems that the org is reacting with the green star. The energy it receives from the green star seems to make the orb’s abilities more intense.”

Gramps “What can we do?” Gramps said worried.

Seth “It’ll stop soon. When his muscle density passes a certain point, the feeling will become more dull. However, it also appears to me that…”

What else is happening?
1411222111121112.title: The battle was stopped for some reason.

choices: Not to happy. He doesnt like how his body looks. (And he can't scratch his back)
Excited! He loves and embraces the growth.
14112221111211121.content:
Seth “…It seems that he is growing to fast, and that he isn’t getting compressed fast enough.”

Everyone looked at Ben more closely and saw that what he said was true. Ben’s above average muscle were growing. You could almost sense the power that they held.

Ben started to straighten out as the pain subsided. He had heard that he was growing again. He looked at himself and saw that it was true. He flexed his muscles and was surprised to see that they kept the size of when they were flexed. Is this a good thing or a bad thing? Will he look like a bulky giant with the tiny head of a 10 year old? As the seconds ticked by Ben grew more and more. He got to 5ft 8in and then 6ft 6in with body builder muscles. His arms were cannons of raw power, and his pecs pushed a foot off his body. His neck was a tree trunk, and his 8pac abs were chiseled so deep that Gwen could fit her whole hand inside. His legs looked like they could hold up the statue of liberty with ease. “Oh… my… God…”. Just as he said that, his growth seemed to stop.

Seth “It appears that your body has reached equilibrium. You’re groing as fast as you’re being compressed.”

Gwen gasped at Ben’s size. He could dwarf any person on earth! “You huge!”

How does Ben react?
14112221111211121.title: Ben was growing faster than he was getting comp...

choices: An enemy comes and attacks. The battle resumes.
141122211112111211.content:
Ben “I know… I am huge…” Ben said sadly.

Gramps sensed the disappointment in Ben’s voice “I’m sure something can be done.”

Seth “Yah… Just wait a while. As your body’s density increases, you will shrink down to an average size. I think you weight about 1000lbs due to Gwen’s spell, but with out it, you would have a gravitational pull strong enough to make the sun orbit you.”

Ben perked up immediately “Well Since I’ll get back to normal soon, I think I’ll just see what this body can do.” Ben struck various poses in the middle of space and started to punch various invisible objects. At the same time, a small shuttle was come towards them.

Everyone stopped and stared as the shuttle started getting closer. When it was a mile away, it sent a white beam of light towards them, and pulled them into the ship.
141122211112111211.title: Not to happy. He doesnt like how his body looks...

1411222111121112111.content:
As they entered the shuttle threw the floor, they found themselves in an airplane type setting. There were aliens wearing flight attendant clothing and serving snacks and other stuff.

A voice from an intercom “Max. Nice of you to join us. We need to plan a strategy quickly. This war is hopeless. The enemy had to much time to prepare. We have to go straight to the problem.”

Gramps frowned “You were always to the point. No hello or long time no see.”

The voice “There is never time. Going threw those trivialities wastes saves oxygen and time.”

Ben “Who is this guy gramps?”

Gramps “This is Xam, my younger twin brother.”

A door opened behind them “Yes… by a near 5 minutes. However, no time. Back to business…… Wow. Who are these?”

Gramps “This if my niece Gwen, and my nephew Ben.”

Xam “How old are they. The girl there is Gwen I assume, and that kid with the tan is Ben?”

Ben “Actually, I’m Ben.” Ben said in a deep voice.

Xam turned and faced Ben and was shocked by Ben’s colossal size “How old are you?”

Ben “10”

Xam’s mouth hung open, but closed shortly as he muttered “I’ve seen stranger than this. Get used to it.” … “Care to tell me how you got so… large?”

Ben looked at gramps to see if it was ok. Gramps nodded, and Ben took out his Growthium orb. “Because of this.”

Xam lost his composure again “Where did you get that!”

Ben “It crashed into my nuts back on earth. Hurt like crazy”

Xam starts to mumble things as though he were sorting his thoughts “Ok. Since you’re Ben, who’s the kid with the tan?”

Seth answered “I’m Seth, but you probably know me as VERITAS, the book that helped Spectus.

Xam “Impossible! Spectus took VERITAS to his grave!”

Seth “Actually, I disappeared after Spectus was in his grave, and not I am Seth and Gwen is the cause of my return.”

Xam turned to Gwen when Seth said her name “You… have… the legendary VERITAS?”

Gwen frowned and understood why Gramps didn’t like Xam “I don’t own SETH. I work with him, and he works with me. Kind of like close companions.”

Seth stood at the side shocked, but also happy to hear Gwen say that.

All of a sudden there was a…

What is it?
1411222111121112111.title: We get to meet Xam.

choices: Ben shrinks down while waiting, but the plan continues.
The Green Star supernovas faster than expected.
14112221111211121112.content:
The doors open show a small blue alien with one large eye. It waddled up to Xam and made a serious of indistinguishable sounds.

Xam “It seems that the enemy is getting ready to collect the energy from the Green Star. The supernova goes off in 20hrs. Our spies tell me that the enemy has created a device capable of containing the supernova, and storing the energy it creates. We don’t know what though. We have to destroy it.”

Ben “Then why don’t you? can’t you just fire some large laser at it?”

Xam frowned “Its not that simple. The enemy has placed it in the middle of their army and surrounded it with the latest technology to prevent any attack. We’ll have to go head on.”

Ben “There’s another solution. I could go in using the Omnitrix. I could change into Ghost Freak and sneak threw.”

Xam “You have the Omnitrix!” Xam stopped talking for a moment “Ok… no more questions. Just do what you need to do to destroy that machine.”

Ben smiled and turned to his hugely muscle arm. He look at the Omnitrix and saw that it had grown to fit his newly enlarged wrist. “Alright… Some action.”

Gramps “Hold on their sport. Are you sure about this?”

Ben “Yup! Nothing can stop these muscles. Plus Ghost Freak is intangible, so nothing can stop him.”

Gramps sighed “Ok. Be careful”

Xam “It settled. Ben will leave in 10hrs. We need to time to make a back-up just incase Ben doesn’t succeed. Everyone I dismissed.”

What happens now?
14112221111211121112.title: A messenger arrives with news.

choices: Ben reports his findings to Xam
141122211112111211121.content:
Ben was taken to a small room with a bed and a window, and various other objects. As he sat there, he felt kid of tired from the events of the day, and decided to catch some Z’s while he waited. When he was asleep, his body started to shrink down.

*9 Hrs later*

Ben woke up with a start and rubbed his eye. He was shocked to see that his arm had shrunk down to his previous size. Though his body felt different than before. Ben looked at his body and saw nothing new. He gave his arm a pinch, and felt the hard muscle beneath the skin. “I wonder that this feeling is.” Ben shrugged it off for now, but would ask about it later.

After a little while, someone came and told Ben to get ready to leave. When it came time, Ben met with everyone at the deployment hatch.

Gramps “Good luck. Be back by dinner”

Gwen “Break a leg dweeb”

Ben “Thanks”. Ben turned the watch on and turned into Ghost Freak, but something was off. Ghost Freak was the size of a star! When Ben’s compressed body was decompressed when he turned into Ghost Freak. “Wow” Ben thought.

Ben slowly glided threw space until he got to the enemy base. When he drifted over the entire area with his body, he felt the minds of everyone he passes threw. Ben learnt that the machine was gone already, and that it wasn’t a ‘single’ machine, but billions of satellites that will circle around the star and encase it in a force field.

What happens now?
141122211112111211121.title: Ben shrinks down while waiting, but the plan co...

choices: The core of the Green Star!
It was Ben's orb! Its got huge!
1411222111121112111211.content:
As Ben was making his way back over to Xam’s base, the Green Star started to become volatile. The entire enemy camp was in a frenzy trying to prepare to harness the power of the star, while Xam’s ship was also mobilizing.

Ben got out of enemy territory, but didn’t have time to get to Xam’s ship because the Omnitrix timed out. There was a flash, and Ben turned back into Ben. “God! I didn’t make it.” Ben felt a strange tug in his pocket. Ben took the green orb out and saw that it was pulling him towards the green star. It was slow at first, but it picked up speed.

*Thump*

Ben seemed to hit something invisible. As he looked around, he saw that there were countless satellites scattered in geometric patterns. They all emitted an energy field that connected with the other satellites. “Oh no.” Ben started to pound at the force field when a sudden flash cough his eye. It appears that the green sun was shrinking as it burned up the rest of its fuel, then BOOM! The green star supernovas. It sends waves of energy outwards, but the energy was being stopped. The force field surrounding the star was maintaining control, but it was being contorted. Ben saw this, and worked even harder to break the force field.

*Back at the Ship*

Everyone was working like crazy to get the ship close enough to do any form of damage.

Gwen and Seth on the other hand were sitting down talking.

Gwen “What do you think we should do?”

Seth “Currently, Ben is the only one who can do anything, but we can help. I think the best solution is to remove the spell that makes him weigh as much as he looks. I think that will apply enough force to break the force field.”

Gwen thought it over for a moment “Yah… That seems right.” Gwen says a quick phrase and the spell on Ben vanishes.”

*Back with Ben*

Ben felt a sudden increase in his weight. He could feel that Gwen’s spell was gone by the weight of his arms when they punched at the force field, but also because the force field was starting to sink where Ben was. His tremendous weight was put the force field in his area under a lot of stress until -pop- Ben made a hole in the force field where the energy from the Star could escape, but that’s not all that happened. As soon as the energy got out, it started to orbit around Ben at unreal speeds. At the same time, the orb in Ben’s hand starts to float up a bit and absorb the energy from the Green Star. Ben felt like he was in the middle of a tornado of raw energy. After a few second, the energy was gone, and all that was left was a strange solid.

What is it?
1411222111121112111211.title: The Star supernovas

choices: It can grow others if Ben wants it to.
It has gained a few new unique properties.
14112221111211121112111.content:
Ben’s were blinded by all the light that the energy gave off, but when his eyes cleared, he was surprised to see that the star was gone. All except for his orb and a strange substance that was in the a little further away, but it seemed to be getting closer.

When it got to Ben, Ben saw that it was a green liquid that was glowing green. Ben stared for a bit until his orb floated up to the substance and absorbed it.

As the green orb took the substance in, it began to change. The green orb was originally a crystalline green. You could see through it, and it had no other features. Now how ever, it has a single solid dot in the center that was about the side of a pearl. The orb was still the size of a softball. The pearl in the middle was glowing green, and it had a pulse. Every time that it had a pulse, it would give off a wave of energy. Ben stared and was curious to what it was, but he didn’t get to stare for long.

*loud screaming, yelling, etc*

Ben looked up from his orb and finally saw that he had been surrounded by the enemy army. They were in a frenzy trying to collect the energy, but Ben foiled their plan. There had to be billions if not trillions of enemies surrounding him. Ben went to the Omnitrix only to find that it hadn’t recharged yet. As the enemy drew closer, Ben prepared to fight. “I think I can do this.” He was hoping that with his new strength that he could make a straight line to freedom. However, there was a purple flash, and something grabbed his neck. Ben went to grab it and throw it away, but there was another flash of purple, and he found himself on the ship again.

Gwen “Looked like you were in a bit of a predicament.”

Ben looked around totally confused. He had prepared himself to fight for hours if not days, but that quickly ended when he found himself on the ship. “Yah. I was. I thought I’d be there for days.”

Gramps “Actually, I think it would be weeks. The army would surround you as you took it down one by one. Maybe even months. Though, I think you have the stamina for it.”

Ben “If it took that long, then I could have just used the Omnitrix at some point.”

Gramps nodded thoughtfully “Yah. I guess that’s true.”

Ben suddenly remember something “Why don’t I weigh like a billion pounds right now? I thought you took the spell off.”

Gwen “I did, but I put another one on you, so we had to improvise. We are in an anti gravity room. No matter what you are, or how much you weigh, you will have next to zero weight in here. It also nullifies any gravitational pull.”

Ben looked around trying to comprehend what they were saying “So what is the solution now? Why can you reapply it now?”

Gwen “I can not. Seth told my that it can only be used once per person due to its unique effect.”

Ben “That what now?”

Gramps “I think I know of something that can help, but we’ll have to ask Xam a favor.”

Ben “I think he owes us a favor for stopping the army.”

Gwen “Actually, we didn’t stop them. We escaped them.”

Ben “What ever. We foiled their plan in the end. Now what are we asking him for?”

Gramps “Its just a rare mineral called Gravitum. It has properties similar to Gwen’s spell. However, you need it with you at all time. That’s the only down side.”

Ben “Cool. Is that all it can do?”

Gramps “It has one more property. When it is molded into a shape of a container. Kind of like a locket. It gains the ability to store anything no matter that the size, and keep it sealed until the owner opens it.”

Ben “So I could put the orb into it?”

Gramps “Yes. Exactly.”

Ben “What are we weighting for? Lets go get it.” Ben starts making his way to the door, but he was dragged back by a tentacle of magic. “Gwen! What was that for?”

Gwen “Idiot! If you walk out of here, you’d kill us all! You gravitational pull would make the ship collapse on itself”

Ben looked at Gwen ready to comment, but looked at his feet I the end chastised. “Fine then. When is Xam going to bring this thing. I’m dying to go somewhere.”

Xam “Did someone say my name?” Xam said as he entered the room. “Ben… you are such a pain like your Grandfather.”

Gramps “Excuse me! I was the one mature enough to keep you out of trouble most of the time.”

Xam “That’s why you were a pain, butt this is besides the point. I’m only giving this to Ben because he is drawing about 90% of the ships energy to keep him from killing us all.”

Brn “What are you giving me?”

Xam takes out a box and opens it to reveal a necklace made of some linked metals. Kind of like a chain, but it had a more complex design. At the bottom was a small locket. It was the shape of 3D compass. There was a needle suspended in the needle spinning and pointing everywhere as it looked for some kind of location. “I have dozens of these Gravitum necklaces, but everyone on this ship told me to give you this one. It has the usual properties, but it also has one more unique ability. The compass right here points to the location of what ever you are looking for.”

Ben looked at the necklace with curiosity. When Xam gave Ben the necklace, Ben had held it for a moment, and then put it on. There was a humming sound that appeared, and slowly faded away. “I feel kind of weird. Everything is weightless again. My body feels like it weighs nothing.”

Gramps “Good. That’s how we know its working.”

Ben “That’s one problem solved, but I think a new one came up. When I got near the Green Star, my”

Xam “You orb absorbed the energy it released.”

Ben looked in surprise “How’d you know?”

Xam “Anyone with a pair of eyes could see it from a light year away.”

Ben “Oh… Anyhow, I’ve felt strange ever since. There was this liquid after all the energy was gone, but my orb absorbed that to! Now it feels like the orb’s alive. It even has a pulse.”

Everyone looked at Ben, and when he took the orb out, they all saw that he was right. The orb was gave off pulses of light that faded away. “See?”

Seth “I don’t know what’s going on, but I have a hunch. I believe that your orb had taken the energy and the remaining core of the Green Star and compressed it into that pearl at the center of your orb. I think that pearl IS the green star, or what ever is left of it. It astounds me that so much energy can me compressed into such a small size.”

Ben looked at his orb with new wonder “But what doe it do now?”

Seth “I don’t know. Lets try to find out.”

What does it do?
14112221111211121112111.title: The core of the Green Star!

choices: Nothing. Lets just go home and enjoy summer.
141122211112111211121112.content:
Ben “What can we do to test it?”

Seth “Well… I don’t know. This isn’t magic, but actually reality remember?”

Ben “Then lets just look at it for a bit.” After a few minutes, Ben noticed something “Hey look at that.” Ben points to a scar on Xam’s forearm. Everyone looks and was surprised to see that it was disappearing. “Your scar. Its gone.”

Xam stared in awe at what just happened. Then he smile. “I think we found one property.”

Gramps nodded “What else can it do?” At that moment, a servant came in to give refreshments. The alien looked tired and worn out from the events of the day, but when it got into the green light of the orb, it started to feel less tired and had a stronger hop in its step. “We have another property I guess. It can heal and re-energize. It seems to deal with any physical/body related ailments. Like injury and weariness. Can it cure a cold?”

Xam “We can find out. Lets go to the infirmary.” Xam leads the group to another section of the ship and there that found countless ailing aliens. “Try healing them. Some of them have known diseases.”

Ben stepped forward to the alien in front of him, and took the orb out of his pocket. As soon as the light hit the alien, it began to heal. Even the horrid gash on his leg had vanished. As Ben raised the orb higher, all the ailing alien began to heal at a tremendous rate. One alien lost an arm, but that grew back with a little time. After half an hour, all the aliens were as good as new. Even the older aliens looked younger (at least in the eyes of their species).

Xam was lost for words. Most of the aliens in the room were in critical condition and would have dies, but Ben’s orb healed all of them with out any effort.

Ben “I guess it, but think we know enough about the orb to say that it won’t have negative side effects.”

Seth “Well… you are growing at an exponential rate now. Billions of times faster than before. I only know this because you are a living organism, and you release mana. All living thing release mana, but yours is huge. The mana around an organism is the magnetic field of that organism. It has a shape. The larger the mana, the larger the magnetic/mana field. Gwen’s is larger than most because she if unique, but yours is the largest in the universe. If you could control it, the universe would be in the palm of your grasp. Though, it’s a good thing you can’t. You mana field is about the diameter of a large star, and getting bigger. Gwen’s is the size of the Earth because I magnify her magic abilities. You have a near infinite supply of mana, and that could be useful. Gwen could tap into that power if you allowed her, but currently, it’s a blocked off source of power.”

Ben stared dumbly and confused “I don’t really get it, but I’m like a power outlet, and if Gwen taps into that outlet, she will have a lot of power?”

Seth “In a nut shell”

Ben “Why didn’t you say so! It’d save a whole lot of time.”

Seth “I know, but some people want to hear the facts.” Giving a grin to everyone else.

Ben “Whatever… can we go home? I want to enjoy the rest of my summer.”

Seth “Good point… I believe that we’ll have to wait for Gwen’s mana field to recharge. Over using it reduces the size, but it will recover with a bit of sleep.”

Gwen “Anyway. We can’t leave yet. The alien army won’t stop so easily. They’re look you this hip right now.”

Ben “Good point. Just tap into my mana, and do something about it.”

Seth “That’s a nice idea. If you want to go along with this idea, I suggest spell 359. It makes people forget what they were doing.”

Gwen “How are we going to do this? What do we do?”

Seth “First off, you’ll have to hold hands. That’s a physical contact, but then you’ll need to establish a mental link. The mana will flow threw your minds and your bodies. Just think about holding hands in your heads and the mana will do the rest. Once the link is established, Gwen can tap into Ben’s mana when ever she wants until you sever the connection.”

Ben and Gwen walked up to each other and held hands and imagined them selves holding hands. To both of them, it felt like someone opened a door, and they could peer into the other person’s head. They could feel each other’s presence, but they couldn’t see or communicate with each other.

Ben “Is that it? Nothing’s different.”

Gwen “True. Though I don’t feel as tired as before. I think your mana is help me a bit.”

Seth “Yah. You can use the mana that is surrounding Ben, but since it is so huge, it is surrounding all of us plus anything within a couple hundred thousand mile radius. Gwen could be anywhere in this mana field and tap into its power.”

Ben “Really? That’s awesome. Give it a shot Gwen.”

Gwen “Kay” Gwen snapped her fingers to make a ‘small’ flame appear, but when it materialized, it was sever meters in diameter. She was shocked by it size, and quickly extinguished it. “Wow… I was trying to make a small flame. That was huge!”

Ben “AM I suppose to feel a drain of energy or something? I didn’t feel anything.”

Seth “Usually, a flame that large would make a regular mana user tired, but since your mana field is so large, the drain is miniscule.”

Ben “That’s good t know. Now how about that spell? I think it would be a good time to use it.”

Gwen “Right… spell 359.” Gwen looked threw her book and found the spell. It was fairly simple to use on one being, but when you get to huge numbers, it would be impossible without help. Gwen began to locate the enemy with mana, and used the spell when she located them. As soon as she said that, the enemy went into a frenzy. They were wondering why they were floating around in space with aliens that they have never seen. Some attacked each other, and others fled. How ever, there was one alien that did nothing. It was ...
141122211112111211121112.title: It has gained a few new unique properties.

1411222111121112111211122.content:
Ben “Looks like the spell worked. Lets go home. This is to much excitement for me.”

Gramps “Agreed. Gwen… care to do the honors?”

Gwen then warped them back to Earth, just outside the Rustbucket.

As soon as their eyes cleared from the purple lights, Ben ran inside and went to bed. Gwen and Gramps followed behind quickly.

*Review of the rest of summer*

As the last month of summer timed down, things were on the dull side. After all that had happened at the green star, nothing seems as exciting. The newest thing Ben had learnt was how to put his orb inside the compass. Then when it was inside, the compass made the orb invisible. As though it never existed. The orb couldn’t heal or glow or anything. Well… it still made Ben grow like crazy. That’s it though.

A week after the Green Star events, there was the occasional alien sighting. Ben finished it off quickly by giving the alien a quick beating, and then throwing it into space. Though, Gwen and Ben traded positions every now and then. Gwen would sometimes send the alien to another planet.

Near the end of summer, Ben and Gwen had to get ready to go home. Gramps was sitting on a log while he whittled a stick. Ben stepped up to him and gave Gramps the Omnitrix.

Ben “Its not fair that just Gwen and I get all the cool stuff. Also… there’s to much power for me to do anything with it. Its to tempting.”

Gramps stared at Ben and gave him a hard look. After a moment, Gramps smile and ruffles Ben’s hair. With that, Ben left, and enjoyed the last fleeting moment of his summer. Gramps on the other hand watched Ben walk away. The Ben that came at the start of the summer was arrogant, playful, wild, and crazy. The Ben that is about to leave was more calm, self controlled, and still playful. Gramps smiled and went back to his whittling.

What happens now?
1411222111121112111211122.title: Nothing. Lets just go home and enjoy summer.

choices: Ken does everything he can to make Ben look bad.
Ken works out hard to try to outclass Ben
14112221111211121112111221.content:
*Ding Dong*

Ben’s father came to the door and opened it to find a young man wearing larger versions of Ben’s cloths.

Ben “Hey dad! How was your summer?”

Dad “Umm. Ben? Is that you?”

Ben looked at his dad with a confused look. “Of course its me. Who else?” Then Ben understood “Oh!!! Yah. I forgot that I got a lot bigger. I started to work out ever the summer with Gramp’s old college weights. It was funny though. I got a growth spurt at the same time, so they gave me awesome results.”

Dad looked at his son disbelievingly, but the proof was right in front of him.

Ben “Um dad… may I come it? Its getting chilly now. Its not summer anymore.”

Dad snapped back into reality “Oh. Right! Yah come in.”

Mom “Hey honey. Is Ben home?”

Dad “Yah he is. He’s a little different though. it’s a good different I think.”

Mom walked out of the kitchen and saw Ben’s new body.

Ben “Hey mom. How was your summer?”

Mom “Its been good. Not to exciting without my boy to make things interesting though.”

Ben “Oh… sorry. I had a blast though. Camping was awesome.”

Mom and dad looked at each other wondering if this was Ben, but what Ben did next was even more surprising.

Ben “May I be excused to my room? Its been a long day because of all the packing.”

Mom and Dad stare at Ben in disbelief. Ben just ‘asked’ ‘politely’ to go to ‘his’ room. The old Ben would have just ran there, and skipped all the greetings.

Dad “Uh.. Sure sport. Go get some sleep. Mom and I’ll help you unpack later.”

Ben thanked them ‘nicely’ and walked upstairs to his room.

Mom “You father is a miracle worker. What’s his secret?”

Dad “I don’t know. I just don’t know.” He said in amazement.

*The first day of school*

Dad “Have a nice day at school Ben. Mom will pick you up later if you want. Just give her a call.”

Ben “Thanks dad. See yah later.” Ben stepped out of the car and walked toward his school. It was a larger school to. Their town doesn’t have a separate middle school. The Elementary and Middle school were combined into a jumbo school. The elementary half was the first three floors, and the middle school half was the fourth through fifth floor.

Ben walked into the school and went to homeroom on the third floor where the sixth graders were. When he got there, he recognized a bunch of kids, and said ‘hi’, but they all gave him a look, and turned back to their conversations. “Hey look at the new kid”. They all said.

When homeroom started, Ben had found an out of the way seat. No one would notice him if he sat quietly. Everyone else soon followed and sat down somewhere. Strangely, they were all kids from last year’s homeroom. When the teacher came out to take attendance, everyone became quiet.

Teacher “We have a new student joining this homeroom today. You may have met him. Lets see if you’ll notice the name.” The teacher worked her way down the list of names. Its was strange because Ben’s name was last, and the new kid’s name was right before his.

“Ken Ten” The teacher said. She waited for Ben to raise his hand and say ‘here’ because she thought he was the new kid, but Ben never did.

“Excuse me. I said Ken Ten.” Ben just sat waiting for his name. “Fine then. I’ll mark you absent. Next is Ben Tennyson.”

Everyone stared at the door waiting for a short kid with brown hair to open the door, but it never came. “Here.” Ben said while raising his arm.

Everyone turned around and say that a large six grader was raising his hand. All the students started to gossip and comment. Ben sat down with his face turning red from the attention.

Teacher looked amazed at Ben’s change “Ben… is that really you? You got to big. And it was only one summer.”

Ben “Yah I know… I started working out over the summer, but I also had a growth spurt at the same time. Not just a regular one either. My family has been known to have growth spurt earlier than most people, and its several times more effective. So the work outs and the growth spurt made me kind of big.”

Teacher stared in awe at Ben’s new size unable to believe her eyes and ears. In the end, she just accepted it as fact and move on. “It appears that our ‘real’ new student has yet to show up. That’s a bad start for a new year.”

As soon as she said that, a kid with dirty blond hair and a heavier than normal kind of build casually strolled into the room like it was nobody’s business. “Sorry I’m late, but my alarm didn’t go off. Its takes sleep to get these muscle to grow. The kid failed to notice the much larger kid in the back with a noticeably larger build than his own. Don’t get me wrong. James is still ’just slightly’ above average.

Ken was waiting for people to stop and comment about his physique. He heard murmurs about muscle and other things, but they weren’t about him. They were about that kid in the back! Ken frowned when he heard the name Ben and not Ten. “Excuse me. You guys may have miss heard. My name is Ken. Not Ben. They sound similar, so I’ll let it go.”

Teacher sounded annoyed “Ok Ken sit down. I believe that everyone is talking about Ben. The student in the back. They shouldn’t be talking at all actually” The teacher gives a hard glare at the class.

Ken looked around for this ‘Ben’ that he heard so much about. The kid can’t be that much of a news story. Ken looked in the back, and saw this 13 year old kid with a really developed athletic build. Its was the body of speed, agility, strength, and a little more. Ken stared at Ben jealously of his body, and even angrier about being outclassed. At his old school, he was the top dog! The reigning champ of the school in all athletics! He won’t go down so easily.

What happens now?
14112221111211121112111221.title: First day of sixth grade.

choices: Tries to find a quick way to grow
141122211112111211121112212.content:
Ken walked to the back of the calls in order to get a closer look at his competition. It was clear that Ben worked out ‘a lot’, and that he looks strong. But that’s all for show. There’s no strength behind it. ‘Ken assumes’

Ken stepped up to Ben “Hey. I’m Ken. Nice to meet a fellow exercise addict.” Ken holds out his hand to shake with Ben.

Ben “Hey. I’m Ben. Nice to meet you to.” Ben reaches out and they shake hands. Ben give him a gentle grasp in order to not break his hand. Other the last month of summer, Ben had worked on self control in order not to destroy things by accident. He’s improved significantly, and has 99.99% mastery of his body.

Ken on the other hand likes to make sure his peers know who’s the strongest, so when Ben and Ken held hands, Ken squeezed Ben’s hand as hard as he could to make Ben scream in pain. However, instead of crushing his fingers, it was like shaking hands with a rock. Ben didn’t feel the pressure from the squeeze due to his dense muscles, and strong bones.

Ken smiled a fake smile to hide his shock, and sat down. He thought “What just happened? No can not show some kind of reaction to that kind of hand shake.” Ken was about the size of a middle school 8th grader. He was 5ft 3in, and about 160. Which was a lot for someone his height and age. There was actual strength in this 6th grader’s arm.

Ben on a similar hand was 5ft 4in, and about 165 lbs in appearance. To bad Ken doesn’t know that he’s setting himself up for an impossible task.

After homeroom, was first period. Which was gym. YAH!!!

The first day of gym at this school is always a fitness test. They compared your strength from the first day with your strength from the last day.

As they all stepped inside, mats and lines were drawn all over the floor for the fitness exam. There was push-up, pull-up, sit-up, mile runs, sprints, flexibility, etc.

Ken couldn’t wait to show everyone who is really the strongest. He believed that Ben’s muscles were all air, and no definition. People were assigned partners to compete with, and Ken was happy to find that he was paired with Ben.

-Push Ups: Goal is to do as many push up as you physically can.

Ken and Ben lined up next to each other doing a plank as they waited for the ‘go’ that would tell them to start. “GO!” Ben and Ken started immediately. Ben was taking his sweet time and doing his push up with a rhythmic pattern. Ken on the other hand was going all out. After 35 push up, Ken was dying. Ben on the other hand was barely even sweating. At 45 push up, Ken was dismayed to see that he couldn’t go on, and fell. Ben on the other hand kept going and going and going. At about 100, the coach said enough, and told Ben and Seth to move onto Pull-ups.

-Pull-ups: Do as many as you can.

Same result as push up

-Sit ups: as many as you can

Same results as pulls ups.

-Both Sprinting and running.

You know the answer

-Flexibility: Reach as far past your toes as possible

This was a close one, but Ben won.

As the day ended, Ken couldn’t stop think about how he lost ‘all’ of those tests. He didn’t beat Ben once.

What does Ken do?
141122211112111211121112212.title: Ken works out hard to try to outclass Ben

choices: Looks for a faster way to get stronger.
1411222111121112111211122121.content:
From that day forth, Ken works out at the gym when ever he had time. He worked for hours and hours. Even to the point that his grades were dropping. He became obsessed with growing and becoming bigger than Ben. He had to slow down a bit though because his parents had gone far enough to almost ban him from the gym if his grades didn’t go up. After that, Ken was more careful with his grades, but worked out every spare second to make up for the time. After a week or to, Ken started to freak out. He was actually losing weight. His coach told him that he has to eat more because he’s burning to many calories, and his body doesn’t have the fuel to grow. (I got the idea from taylor lautner). Any how, after 5 months, or serious work out, Ken had managed to put on 50 lbs of muscle. This gave him a freakish body. He was only 11 years old like every other sixth grader, but his body was has bulky as a junior bodybuilder. (Oh right. Ben is now eleven years old. He had his birthday during the summer, and he had grown a smidge taller and bigger.)

Near the end of January, Ken was super huge and intimidating. He had worked up the will to finally challenge Ben again. Ken was about twice as bulky as Ben.
Ken was 5ft 6in now, and weighing 210lbs
Ben was 5ft 6in as well, and 180lbs

It was lunch time, and Ben was sitting at the center table talking with the only girl that was nice to him last year.

Ken walked up to the table and slammed his elbow down. “Arm Wrestle. NOW!”

Ben stared at Ken in shock at the intensity in his voice “Umm. You could say please. That’d be more polite.”

Ken glared at Ben impatiently, but finally worked up the politeness “Fine… PPLLLEEEAAASSSEEE” As though we was choking on something.

Ben “That’s more like it. Are you sure you want to wrestle? I won’t go easy?”

Ken “Ha! You’ll have to go as hard as you can if you want to beat my tank of a body.”

Ben sighed, and set his arm on the table. They grasped each other’s hands, and waited for someone to referee. A kid that was already between Ben and Ken counted down “3...2...1... Go!” Ken went all out at the start. Ben on the other hand decided to go easy on Ken. He let his arm go back a bit, but after a while, it was clear the Ben looked like he wasn’t trying, so Ben finished it. Ken’s arm was hit by a truck and hit the table. Everyone had expected Ken to win since he had a slight advantage at the start, but also because he was even bulkier then Ben. When Ben won, everyone was silent for a second, but they all cheered in the end.

Ken looked at his arm in total shock and disappointment. He was so ready to win. To reclaim the glory that he was used to, but he had lost. “HOW! How can you beat me?”

Ben gave Ken a poker face and said “Because you are weak.” Ben had known that Ken wanted to humiliate Ben for a while. Ben had gotten annoyed over the past few months, and he couldn’t hide his frustration from his voice.

Ken looked up at Ben and hated how Ben looked down at him. He swore under his breath and cursed Ben. He swore to make Ben bow down to him one day.

A teacher came and dispersed the crowd, and everyone left after that. The last person to leave was Ken.

What happens now?
1411222111121112111211122121.title: Works hard (a couple months later)

choices: Tests his new strength at school tomorrow.
14112221111211121112111221211.content:
After the humiliation, Ken finally realized that he could never get stronger than Ben naturally. So the only choice was unnatural. He was above steroids so he threw that idea into the bucket. He went online and looked up various ways to grow. There were hundreds of supplements, and they all had good results, but Ken had already tried them all. Finally when he was about to give up hope, he saw an ad pop up on the side bar. “New Product Being Tested. Testers Try for Free!”

Ken clicked on it and got the address. He found the directions to it, and began his long walk. As he walked, he noticed the that the suburban setting changed to an industrial feeling. When he got to the address, he was at a large facility surrounded with fencing and barbed wire. Looked like an army base, and not so much a lab, or commercial body supplement facility.

Ken stepped up to a small gate designed for cars only, and talked into a box. “Hello? I’m here from that Ad looking for a tester.”

The box crackled for a moment then a voice started to speak “Ok. come right in.” The gates swing open and Ken stepped threw. He followed a path until he got to the white building. When he arrived at the door, a lady greeted him.

Lady “Dr. Wess is working in his lab. He’s the owner and mastermind of this whole organization. He recently discovered a way to cure muscular defects, wants to see if the cure can also grow normal muscles.”

Ken was listening, and her words filled him with hope. This might be what he was looking for. She started to guide him threw a catacomb of hall ways and elevators. They got to the bottom floor and what Ken saw surprised him.

The room was very well lit, and it showed a massive floor filled with all sorts of machines and equipment. However, there was one vacant area, and that was the middle of the room. In it was an old man tinkering with a laser type of machine.

Lady “Excuse us Dr. Wess, but we have a person who would like to help you test your new discover.”

Dr. Wess looked up from the ray, and saw Ken looking at him intently. “Hello there. You want to test this out? My… aren’t you already big enough? How old are you?”

Ken looked at the old man, and frowned a bit, but smile again to be polite. “Yah. I work out a little. I’m thirteen, but I’m looking to try something new.”

Wess “Very good. That’s what I look for. Enthusiasm! Ok… Come here boy. We’ll start the test now.” When the Wess said that, the lady excused herself, and left.

Ken “What do I do?”

Wess “Just step in front of the ray and sit patiently. You’ll feel a light tingle, but it’ll be nice.”

Ken stepped in front of the ray and was about to ask a question, but the doctor had already fired the ray. A green light shot out and enveloped Ken.

Ken felt a tingle all over his body, but that soon died down. The next feeling was amazing. He felt like he was having the great pump in the world. He could feel his muscles stretching and ripping, but then healing back almost instantly. His bones began to stretch and grow to accommodate his new size. As he continued to grow, his cloths were beginning to fail. His shirt was already split down the middle and the sleeves were rendered useless a while ago. His jeans had torn off and all that was left were some briefs that looked more like speedos. It didn’t matter because the python they hid was pulsing with power beneath the thin cloth.

When the growth slowed to a stopped, he had gained about 70lbs of muscle. He now had basket ball arms, with shoulders so broad that from shoulder to shoulder, they measured 2ft 6in. His pecs pushed 8in off his body, and his abs were so deep that you could fit your whole hand in it. His thighs were over stuffed turkey dinners, and his calves were bowling balls.
